content.text: Explain what is meant by _deceleration_

impulse = .........

His boot is in contact with the ball for \(0.050 \mathrm{s}\). The average resultant force on the ball during this time is \(180 \mathrm{N}\). The ball leaves his foot at \(20 \mathrm{m / s}\)
Calculate
While the boot is in contact with the ball, the ball is no longer spherical
State the word used to describe the energy stored in the ball
A footballer kicks a ball vertically upwards. Initially, the ball is stationary
State what is meant by the term weight
Calculate the weight of the equipment on the planet
The mass of the equipment is \(350\mathrm{kg}\). The acceleration of free fall on the surface of this planet is \(7.5\mathrm{m / s}^2\)

The equipment releases a balloon from a point that is a small distance above the surface of the planet. The atmosphere at the surface of this planet has a density of \(0.35\mathrm{kg / m}^3\). The inflated balloon has a mass of \(80\mathrm{g}\) and a volume of \(0.30\mathrm{m}^3\)
Make an appropriate calculation and then predict and explain the direction of any motion of the balloon. Show your working

the names of the thermal processes by which the lamp transfers energy to the surroundings
A 240 V, 60 W lamp is connected to a 240 V supply. The lamp has a constant temperature
State
In Experiment 1, the thermometer bulbs are both painted black. They are placed at equal distances from the surfaces of the block. The maximum temperature shown by each thermometer is recorded
Explain any difference between the maximum temperature shown by the two thermometers
In Experiment 2, the thermometer bulbs are both shiny silver-coloured. They are placed at the same distances from the surfaces of the block as in Experiment 1
State and explain any differences that are observed in the maximum temperatures shown by the thermometers in Experiments 1 and 2
Fig. 4.1 shows a thick copper block that has been heated to \(400^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\). One side of the block is dull black. The other side of the block is polished and shiny
Fig. 4.2 shows a firefighter wearing shiny silver-coloured clothing
State the benefit to a firefighter of wearing shiny silver-coloured clothing

The barrier is adjusted so that the gap becomes wider
